title: Natural Adventures in Florida
text:
By Sidney A Fernandes | Submitted On July 17, 2015 
Apart from theme parks, there are a number of natural adventures in Florida to explore from sunken ships, biking, hiking, camping, hand gliding to fishing, parasailing and ranch vacations. Merely hitting the beach may seem rather boring and although the Sunshine State is teeming with promenades of sand filled promenades, it is also rich in high energy activities for all ages. So if you're looking to beat the stereotype and visit natural adventures in Florida, the following destinations should be on the top of your list. 
The first destination and one of the most absolute thrilling natural adventures in Florida is the expansive 4,700 acre Forever Florida Ranch located on 4755 N. Kenansville Road. This wild conservation area is a cluster of natural streams, exotic wilderness, wetlands and dense Cyprus forests and is bound to satisfy all ages. Whether you want to sit back, relax and appreciate the surroundings or explore the treetop thrills of the Zipline Safari, this state preserved rare wild park is highly recommended. Home to an abundance of flora and fauna including the endangered Florida panther, white tail deer's, alligators, black bears and over 200 species of birds, Forever Florida is a treasure of nine distinct ecosystems. This hub for natural adventures in Florida includes the Cyprus Canopy Cycle and coach and horseback safaris. 
If you're craving adrenaline rush, skydiving at the Florida Skydiving Center is a great way to see the city in a whole new way. The skydiving center offers thrills for the novice and the seasoned pro, and offers students, military and group rates. Whether you're looking forward to your first tandem skydive, freeflying or windsuiting, the center is a great alternative to traditional Disney theme parks. 
Canoeing is one of the many local natural adventures in Florida, and is a great way to connect with the joys of Mother Nature. The Black Water River is one of the most flawless sand water rivers in the United States and apart from canoeing, there are a number of water based activities that can be enjoyed here such as fishing, kayaking, paddling and swimming. Within close proximity of the river are 30 campsites that are equipped with water connections, picnic tables, sewer taps and electricity. The park provides easy access to a number of parks that are a thrill for any tourist such as the Juniper Creek Trail. This is definitely a different type of vacation as there are a number of things to see and do. 
If you're not too keen on seeing Mickey and Shamu, an ideal and one of the high energy natural adventures in Florida is undoubtedly exploring the lakes of Orlando. The lakes give tourists a great opportunity to get up close and personal with some of the finest water species in Florida such as Bass in Lake Toho and Lake Kissimmee. For extreme natural adventures in Florida and an absolute rod bending experience, shark hunting in the Florida Keys is a fantastic choice. There are a number of natural adventures in Florida, but the ones listed above are bound to provide you with an unrivalled experience.
